triples.name: Free lattice
triples.relevance: Free lattices are the central mathematical structure discussed in Lorenzen's work.

triples.name: Proof theory
triples.relevance: The paper contributes to infinitary proof theory by introducing a novel cut elimination method.

triples.name: Cut-elimination theorem
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel double induction proof method for cut elimination without ordinal assignment.

triples.name: Mathematical induction
triples.relevance: Double induction on the cut formula and derivation complexity is the core proof technique employed.

triples.name: Type theory
triples.relevance: The paper provides a constructive consistency proof for ramified type theory without the axiom of reducibility.

triples.name: Axiom of reducibility
triples.relevance: A key achievement is proving consistency of ramified type theory without this axiom, showing it is unnecessary.

triples.name: Consistency
triples.relevance: Proving consistency for formal systems is the main goal of the Investigations.

triples.name: Lattice (order)
triples.relevance: Lattice theory is presented as a bridge between algebra and logic in the paper.

triples.name: Semilattice
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a definition of semilattice as a deductive calculus for constructing free objects.

triples.name: Distributive lattice
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a definition of distributive lattice as a deductive calculus.

triples.name: Boolean algebra
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a definition of countably complete Boolean lattice as a deductive calculus.

triples.name: Elementary Number Theory
triples.relevance: The preliminary manuscript applies the constructive methods to prove consistency for elementary number theory.

triples.name: Preorder
triples.relevance: Preorder-theoretic methods are used for the consistency proofs described in the preliminary manuscript.

triples.name: Sequent calculus
triples.relevance: Sequent calculi are used to describe the formal logical systems being analyzed.

triples.name: Infinitary logic
triples.relevance: The work is recognized as a landmark in the history of infinitary proof theory.
